page.title: 12Healthy Country Air.
page.content: The average age of the local population is quite high, but the people are very healthy. Our researchers have found that many people produce their own vegetables, make their own bread and take plenty of exercise. Doctors, dentists and opticians have practices in Ledbury, but some people are registered with a doctors' practice at Staunton, both places are some four miles away. There are two rest homes, one at Eastnor at Bircham's Grange, which was previously a children's home, and one at Bromesberrow called the Laurels. Bircham's Grange has 17 residents aged between 70 and 95, the Laurels has 20 residents with 16 over 70. All patients receive regular visits from their families. Both homes offer good facilities for their residents, many of whom had interesting hobbies.
